entities: United Nations Organization Mission in the Democratic Republic of the Congo
summary:
The Security Council,
Recalling previous resolutions on the Democratic Republic of the Congo, particularly 1565 (2004), 1592 (2005), 1596 (2005), and 1621 (2005),
Reaffirming commitment to the sovereignty, territorial integrity, and political independence of the Democratic Republic of the Congo and support for the peace and national reconciliation process through MONUC,
Noting the situation in the Democratic Republic of the Congo remains a threat to international peace and security in the region,
Decides to extend MONUC's mandate, as outlined in previous resolutions under Chapter VII of the UN Charter, until 31 October 2005;
Decides to remain seized of the matter.
